summary.span: 表示一个复数。

span.span: Represents a complex number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个复杂的数字是一个包含实数部分和虚数部分的数字。A complex number is a number that comprises a real number part and an imaginary number part. 在窗体 z 通常编写复杂的数字 z = x + 彝语，其中*x*和*y*为实数，和*我*是具有属性的虚单位*i*2 =-1。A complex number z is usually written in the form z = x + yi, where *x* and *y* are real numbers, and *i* is the imaginary unit that has the property *i*2 = -1. 表示复数的实部*x*，并由表示复数的虚部*y*。The real part of the complex number is represented by *x*, and the imaginary part of the complex number is represented by *y*. 类型使用笛卡尔坐标系统 （实数，虚数） 时实例化和操作的复数。The type uses the Cartesian coordinate system (real, imaginary) when instantiating and manipulating complex numbers. 一个复杂的数字可以表示为称为复平面的二维坐标系统中的点。A complex number can be represented as a point in a two-dimensional coordinate system, which is known as the complex plane. 复数的实部定位 x 轴 （水平轴） 上，虚数部分定位在 y 轴 （垂直轴） 上。The real part of the complex number is positioned on the x-axis (the horizontal axis), and the imaginary part is positioned on the y-axis (the vertical axis). 此外可以通过使用极坐标系统根据其绝对值的数值，表示复平面中的任何点。Any point in the complex plane can also be expressed based on its absolute value, by using the polar coordinate system. 在极坐标点的特征是两个数字：In polar coordinates, a point is characterized by two numbers: - 其量值，该值是从原点的点的距离 （即，0，0 或从该处 x 轴和 y 轴相交的点）。Its magnitude, which is the distance of the point from the origin (that is, 0,0, or the point at which the x-axis and the y-axis intersect). - 其阶段，是实轴和从原点到点绘制的线条之间的角度。Its phase, which is the angle between the real axis and the line drawn from the origin to the point. ## 实例化一个复杂的数字Instantiating a Complex Number 通过以下方式之一，可以将值分配给一个复杂的数字：You can assign a value to a complex number in one of the following ways: - 通过将传递两个给其构造函数的值。By passing two values to its constructor. 第一个值表示复数的实部，第二个值表示的虚数部分。The first value represents the real part of the complex number, and the second value represents its imaginary part. 这些值表示复数的二维笛卡尔坐标系统中的位置。These values represent the position of the complex number in the two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate system. - 通过调用静态 (`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中)方法从其极坐标创建复数。By calling the static (`Shared` in Visual Basic) method to create a complex number from its polar coordinates. - 通过将分配， ， ， ， ， ， ， ， ，或值设为对象。By assigning a , , , , , , , , , or value to a object. 值将成为复数的实部和其虚部等于 0。The value becomes the real part of the complex number, and its imaginary part equals 0. - 通过强制转换 （在 C#) 或转换 （在 Visual Basic)或值设为对象。By casting (in C#) or converting (in Visual Basic) a or value to a object. 值将成为复数的实部和其虚部等于 0。The value becomes the real part of the complex number, and its imaginary part equals 0. - 通过将分配方法或运算符返回的复数对象。By assigning the complex number that is returned by a method or operator to a object. 例如，是返回之和的两个复数的复数的静态方法和运算符将两个复数相加，并返回结果。For example, is a static method that returns a complex number that is the sum of two complex numbers, and the operator adds two complex numbers and returns the result. 下面的示例演示了每种分配一个值到复数的五个方法。The following example demonstrates each of these five ways of assigning a value to a complex number. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/cs/create1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/vb/create1.vb#2)] ## 复杂数字的操作Operations with Complex Numbers .NET Framework 中的结构包括成员提供了以下功能：The structure in the .NET Framework includes members that provide the following functionality: - 比较两个复数相加，以确定它们是否相等的方法。Methods to compare two complex numbers to determine whether they are equal. - 若要执行复杂数字的算术运算的运算符。Operators to perform arithmetic operations on complex numbers. 运算符，可执行加法、 减法、 乘法、 除法和复杂数字的一元求反。 operators enable you to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and unary negation with complex numbers. - 若要执行复杂数字的其他数字操作的方法。Methods to perform other numerical operations on complex numbers. 除了四个基本算术运算，可以引发的指定幂的复数、 平方根的复数，并获取复数的绝对值。In addition to the four basic arithmetic operations, you can raise a complex number to a specified power, find the square root of a complex number, and get the absolute value of a complex number. - 执行三角函数运算上复杂数字的方法。Methods to perform trigonometric operations on complex numbers. 例如，可以计算由一个复杂的数字表示的角度的正切值。For example, you can calculate the tangent of an angle represented by a complex number. 注意，因为并属性是只读的则不能修改的现有值对象。Note that, because the and properties are read-only, you cannot modify the value of an existing object. 对其执行操作的所有方法数字，如果它们的返回值属于类型，返回一个新数。All methods that perform an operation on a number, if their return value is of type , return a new number. ## 精度和复杂数字Precision and Complex Numbers 由两个双精度浮点值表示复数的实部和虚部组成部分。The real and imaginary parts of a complex number are represented by two double-precision floating-point values. 这意味着，值，如双精度浮点值，可能会丢失精度作为数值运算结果。This means that values, like double-precision floating-point values, can lose precision as a result of numerical operations. 这意味着，严格比较是否相等的两个值可能会失败，即使两个值之间的差异是由于精度损失。This means that strict comparisons for equality of two values may fail, even if the difference between the two values is due to a loss of precision. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 例如，对数字的对数执行求幂应返回原始的数量。For example, performing exponentiation on the logarithm of a number should return the original number. 但是，在某些情况下，浮点值的精度降低可能导致细微差异的两个值，如以下示例所示。However, in some cases, the loss of precision of floating-point values can cause slight differences between the two values, as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/cs/precision1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/vb/precision1.vb#5)] 同样，以下示例中，其计算平方根编号，在 32 位和 IA64 版本的.NET Framework 上会产生略有不同的结果。Similarly, the following example, which calculates the square root of a number, produces slightly different results on the 32-bit and IA64 versions of the .NET Framework. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/cs/precision1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/vb/precision1.vb#6)] ## 复杂数字、 无穷大和 NaNComplex Numbers, Infinity, and NaN 表示复数的实部和虚部组成部分值。The real and imaginary parts of a complex number are represented by values. 除了介于到，复数的实部或虚数部分的值可以， ，或。In addition to ranging from to , the real or imaginary part of a complex number can have a value of , , or . ，和所有传播任何算术或三角操作中。, , and all propagate in any arithmetic or trigonometric operation. 在下面的示例中，被除会生成一个复数，其实部和虚部都。In the following example, division by produces a complex number whose real and imaginary parts are both . 因此，执行乘法的此值还会生成一个复数，其实部和虚部是。As a result, performing multiplication with this value also produces a complex number whose real and imaginary parts are . 同样，执行溢出的范围的乘法生成类型的复数，其实部和其虚部是。Similarly, performing a multiplication that overflows the range of the type produces a complex number whose real part is and whose imaginary part is . 随后执行此复数与除法运算返回一个复数，其实部和其虚部是。Subsequently performing division with this complex number returns a complex number whose real part is and whose imaginary part is . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/cs/nan1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/vb/nan1.vb#3)] 复杂数字无效或溢出的范围与数学运算数据类型不会引发异常。Mathematical operations with complex numbers that are invalid or that overflow the range of the data type do not throw an exception. 相反，它们返回， ，或在以下情况下：Instead, they return a , , or under the following conditions: - 正数零返回除法。The division of a positive number by zero returns . - 任何操作都溢出的上限数据类型返回。Any operation that overflows the upper bound of the data type returns . - 零返回负数的除法。The division of a negative number by zero returns . - 任何操作都溢出的下限数据类型返回。Any operation that overflows the lower bound of the data type returns . - 零被零除返回。The division of a zero by zero returns . - 在操作数的值执行任何操作， ，或返回， ，或，取决于特定操作。Any operation that is performed on operands whose values are , , or returns , , or , depending on the specific operation. 请注意，这适用于由一种方法执行任何中间计算。Note that this applies to any intermediate calculations performed by a method. 例如的乘法`new Complex(9e308, 9e308) and new Complex(2.5, 3.5)`使用公式 (ac-bd) + （ad + bc） 我。For example, the multiplication of `new Complex(9e308, 9e308) and new Complex(2.5, 3.5)` uses the formula (ac - bd) + (ad + bc)i. 相乘得出的结果的实部的计算的计算结果表达式 9e308 \* 2.5-9e308 \* 3.5。The calculation of the real component that results from the multiplication evaluates the expression 9e308 \* 2.5 - 9e308 \* 3.5. 返回此表达式中的每个中间乘法，并尝试减去从返回。Each intermediate multiplication in this expression returns , and the attempt to subtract from returns . ## 一个复杂的数字格式设置Formatting a Complex Number 默认情况下，一个复杂的数字的字符串表示形式采用格式`(`*实际*`,` *虚部*`)`，其中*实际*和*虚部*的字符串表示形式形成复数的实部和虚部组件的值。By default, the string representation of a complex number takes the form `(`*real*`,` *imaginary*`)`, where *real* and *imaginary* are the string representations of the values that form the complex number's real and imaginary components. 某些重载方法允许自定义的这些字符串表示形式的值以反映特定区域性的格式设置约定或定义的标准或自定义数字以特定格式显示格式字符串。Some overloads of the method allow customization of the string representations of these values to reflect the formatting conventions of a particular culture or to appear in a particular format defined by a standard or custom numeric format string. (有关详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)并[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。)(For more information, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md).) 一种更常见的方法来表示一个复杂的数字的字符串表示形式采用窗体 a + bi，其中是复数的实部，而 b 是复数的虚部。One of the more common ways of expressing the string representation of a complex number takes the form a + bi, where a is the complex number's real component, and b is the complex number's imaginary component. 电气工程中一个复杂的数字通常表示为 + bj。In electrical engineering, a complex number is most commonly expressed as a + bj. 这两种形式之一，可以返回一个复杂的数字的字符串表示形式。You can return the string representation of a complex number in either of these two forms. 若要执行此操作，定义自定义格式提供程序通过实现并接口，然后调用方法。To do this, define a custom format provider by implementing the and interfaces, and then call the method. 下面的示例定义`ComplexFormatter`以的格式的字符串表示一个复数类 a + bi 或 + bj。The following example defines a `ComplexFormatter` class that represents a complex number as a string in the form of either a + bi or a + bj. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/cs/customfmt1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/vb/customfmt1.vb#1)] 下面的示例然后使用此自定义格式化程序显示一个复杂的数字的字符串表示形式。The following example then uses this custom formatter to display the string representation of a complex number. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/cs/customfmt1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.class/vb/customfmt1.vb#4)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 复数的绝对值是等效于其属性。The absolute value of a complex number is equivalent to its property. 实数数值的绝对值 + bi 的计算方式如下：The absolute value of a real number a + bi is calculated as follows: - 如果 b = 0，则结果为 0。If b = 0, the result is 0. - 如果 > b，则结果是 \*(1 + b2/a2)。If a > b, the result is a \*(1 + b2/a2). - 如果 b >，则此结果是 b \* (1 + a2/b2)。If b > a, the result is b \* (1 + a2/b2). 如果溢出的绝对值的数值计算结果，该方法返回或。If the calculation of the absolute value results in an overflow, the method returns either or . 如果任一或属性是和其他属性既不是也不，该方法将返回。If either the or property is and the other property is neither nor , the method returns . ## Examples 下面的示例计算复数的绝对值，并演示它的值等效属性。The following example calculates the absolute value of a complex number and demonstrates that it is equivalent to the value of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法提供实现结构。The method provides the implementation for the structure. 它的性能略高于方法因为它不需要将其参数转换为一个复杂的数字。It performs slightly better than method because it does not have to convert its parameter to a complex number. 两个复数相等，如果相等的实数部分和虚数部分相等。Two complex numbers are equal if their real parts are equal and their imaginary parts are equal. 方法等效于以下表达式：The method is equivalent to the following expression: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.equals/cs/equals1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.equals/vb/equals1.vb#1)]

para.span: 使用方法时要注意，因为看似相等的两个值是可被视为不相等，由于其实部和虚部的组件的精度不同。

span.span: Use the method with caution, because two values that are apparently equivalent can be considered unequal due to the differing precision of their real and imaginary components.
The following example reports that (3.33333, 0.142857) and (10/3, 1/7) are not equal.

[!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.Equals#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.equals/cs/precision1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.Equals#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.equals/vb/precision1.vb#4)]

para.span: 推荐的方法是定义可接受两个值之间的差异的边距 (如。 01%的值的实部和虚部组件之一) 而不是比较是否相等的值。

span.span: One recommended technique is to define an acceptable margin of difference between the two values (such as .01% of one of the values' real and imaginary components) instead of comparing the values for equality.

para.span: 如果两个值之间的差的绝对值是小于或等于该边距的区别是有可能是差异精度，并且，因此，值可能相等。

span.span: If the absolute value of the difference between the two values is less than or equal to that margin, the difference is likely to be due to a difference in precision, and, therefore, the values are likely to be equal.

span.span: if and are not equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法定义的复数是否不相等运算符的运算。The method defines the operation of the inequality operator for complex numbers. 它使代码如下所示：It enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.Inequality#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.inequality/cs/inequality1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.Inequality#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.inequality/vb/inequality1.vb#1)] 不支持自定义的运算符的语言可以通过调用测试是否不相等方法，并反转其值。Languages that do not support custom operators can test for inequality by calling the method and reversing its value. 请注意，由于精度差异，显然相等的两个复数相加可被视为不相等。Note that, because of differences in precision, two complex numbers that are apparently equivalent can be considered unequal. 一种解决方法是实现的比较方法，返回`true`仅复杂数字的两个实部和虚部部分之间的差异超过特定阈值时 (如。 01%的实部或虚分量的值一种复杂数字）。One possible workaround is to implement a comparison method that returns `true` only if the difference between the two real and imaginary parts of the complex numbers exceeds a certain threshold (such as .01% of the value of the real or imaginary component of one of the complex numbers). 有关更多信息，请参见 方法。For more information, see the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于复数 + bi，阶段计算为(b)。For a complex number a + bi, the phase is computed as (b, a). 您可以标识复数的笛卡尔坐标复平面上或通过其极坐标。You can identify a complex number by its Cartesian coordinates on the complex plane or by its polar coordinates. 复数的阶段 （参数） 是由复杂的数字表示的点到实轴从原点 （x 轴和 y 轴的交集） 的点绘制的直线的角度。The phase (argument) of a complex number is the angle to the real axis of a line drawn from the point of origin (the intersection of the x-axis and the y-axis) to the point represented by the complex number. 量值 (由属性) 是由复杂的数字表示的点到起始点的距离。The magnitude (represented by the property) is the distance from the point of origin to the point that is represented by the complex number. 可以实例化一个复数，通过调用基于其极坐标，而不是其笛卡尔坐标方法。You can instantiate a complex number based on its polar coordinates instead of its Cartesian coordinates by calling the method. 若要将阶段从弧度转换为度，将其乘以 180 /。To convert the phase from radians to degrees, multiply it by 180/. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法来实例化一个复杂的数字基于其极坐标，，然后显示的值及其和属性。The following example uses the method to instantiate a complex number based on its polar coordinates, and then displays the value of its and properties. returns.span: 由 指定的当前实例的采用笛卡尔形式的字符串表示形式。

span.span: The string representation of the current instance in Cartesian form, as specified by .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回的复杂数字的字符串表示形式显示在窗体中使用笛卡尔坐标的数值`(` `,` *b*`)`，其中是复数的实部和*b*是其虚数部分。The string representation of the complex number returned by this method displays the number using its Cartesian coordinates in the form `(`*a*`,` *b*`)`, where *a* is the real part of the complex number, and *b* is its imaginary part. 这两并*b*使用常规格式说明符 ("G")，并由定义的区域性的约定格式化`provider`。Both *a* and *b* are formatted using the general format specifier ("G") and the conventions of the culture defined by `provider`. `provider`参数是实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法将返回对象，它提供了格式的实数和虚数返回的字符串中的特定于区域性的信息。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of the real and imaginary numbers in the returned string. 如果`provider`是`null`，返回的字符串进行格式设置使用当前区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the returned string is formatted using the object of the current culture. `provider`参数可以是以下值之一：The `provider` parameter can be one of the following: - 一个表示提供格式设置信息的区域性的对象A object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information - 提供格式设置信息的对象。The object that supplies formatting information. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns the object that supplies formatting information. ## Examples 以下示例显示几个复杂数字的字符串表示形式。The following example displays the string representation of several complex numbers. 结果使用英语-美国 ("EN-US") 和法语-法国 ("FR-FR") 区域性的格式设置约定。The result uses the formatting conventions of the English - United States ("en-US") and French - France ("fr-FR") cultures. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.ToString#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.tostring/cs/tostring2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.ToString#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.tostring/vb/tostring2.vb#2)]

span.span: Converts the value of the current complex number to its equivalent string representation in Cartesian form by using the specified format for its real and imaginary parts.

returns.span: 当前实例的采用笛卡尔形式的字符串表示形式。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回的复杂数字的字符串表示形式显示在窗体中使用笛卡尔坐标的数值`(` `,` *b*`)`，其中是复数的实部和*b*是其虚数部分。The string representation of the complex number returned by this method displays the number using its Cartesian coordinates in the form `(`*a*`,` *b*`)`, where *a* is the real part of the complex number, and *b* is its imaginary part. 这两并*b*使用指定的格式字符串格式化`format`。Both *a* and *b* are formatted using the format string specified by `format`. `format`参数可以是任何有效的标准数字格式说明符或自定义数字格式说明符的任意组合。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard numeric format specifier, or any combination of custom numeric format specifiers. 如果`format`等同于或为`null`，复数的实部和虚部组成部分都将使用常规格式说明符 ("G")。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the real and imaginary parts of the complex number are formatted with the general format specifier ("G"). 如果`format`为其他任何值，该方法将引发。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，更详细地介绍以下主题所述：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following topics: - 有关数字格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)并[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format strings, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关.NET Framework 中的格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式设置类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 返回字符串的格式由为当前区域性的对象。The format of the returned string is determined by the object for the current culture. 具体取决于`format`参数，此对象可以控制在输出字符串中的负号、 组分隔符和小数点符号等符号。Depending on the `format` parameter, this object controls symbols such as the negative sign, the group separator, and the decimal point symbol in the output string. 若要提供除当前区域性以外区域性的格式设置信息，请调用重载。To provide formatting information for cultures other than the current culture, call the overload. ## Examples 以下示例初始化一个复杂的数字，并显示它使用多个标准格式字符串。The following example initializes a complex number and displays it using several standard format strings. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.Complex.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.tostring/cs/tostring3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.Complex.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.complex.tostring/vb/tostring3.vb#3)]
